content.description: A short crack climb passing a roof and up a slabby face, a fun top rope for beginners. Can be led on gear as well. As with most routes at the Cliffhanger the chains are very thin and should be rappelled off when possible to save some wear on the links.
content.protection: Two chain anchors, gear to 4 inches.
content.location: Right most route on Inner Temple Wall

content.description: This is a fun mental warm up route for the cliffhanger. Belay near the rappel anchors adjacent to OG cornered out. Begin by pulling on good sized rails and cracks past the runout but easy section from 2nd to 3rd bolt. The crux is the move from the fourth to fifth bolt with an awkward crimp move over the small roof. Finish with some fun slab moves toward the anchors. As with most routes at the Cliffhanger the chains are very thin and should be rappelled off when possible to save some wear on the links.
content.location: This is located in between Crimp-Tick Combination and OG Cornered out.

content.description: Starts in a very fun lieback crack, slightly overhung but safely bolted. Transitions to very thin face climbing on fairly small and harder to find holds.
content.location: Leftmost climb on the "Inner Temple" wall which is on the Pyramid rock. Faces south towards the Sphinx. Easy to find as the best belay is marked by the bolts that support the knotted down climbers rope. Cant miss this as you must scramble past this area on the way down

pathTokens: Sphinx Rock Area (aka The Cliff Hanger)
